Anyway, go see "The Bad Guys".  Go see this wild, absurd, bonkers, absolutely gorgeous, breathlessly-fun ride.  Not exactly to support DreamWorks, but to show other studios to not be afraid of the kind of strange rides they can take us on.  That it's worth it.

DreamWorks at least had a precedent.

The other studios kind of hit a 2 out of 3.  Despite my concerns about introspection, I think the closest would be a Miyazaki-era Ghibli film, if only because of Miyazaki's previous work in Lupin III (which has been noted as an inspiration).

Every studio has duds, though.  That doesn't make them a bad studio; it just means they tried their best but the whole doesn't mesh well.

That being said - to me - DreamWorks' history probably makes it where this version of "The Bad Guys" was possible.
